description: TO STRIKE A PARAGRAPH FROM THE REPORT OF A COMMITTEE PREPARING A DRAFT OF AN ADDRESS TO THE PRESIDENT IN ANSWER TO HIS SPEECH TO BOTH HOUSES OF CONGRESS; SAID PARAGRAPH READS: "WE ARE HAPPY, SINCE OUR SENTIMENTS ON THE SUBJECT ARE IN PERFECT UNISON WITH OURS IN THIS MATTER, TO DECLARE THAT THE CONDUCT OF THE GOVERNMENT HAS BEEN JUST AND IMPARTIAL TO FOREIGN NATIONS, AND THAT THOSE INTERNAL REGULATIONS, WHICH HAVE BEEEN ESTABLISHED FOR THE PRESERVATION OF PEACE ARE PROPER, AND HAVE BEEN FAIRLY EXECUTED.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION THAT SO MUCH OF THE PRESIDENT'S SPEECH AS RELATES TO THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A PERMANENT SYSTEM OF NAVAL DEFENSE.  BE REFERRED TO A SELECT COMMITTEE, BY STRIKING OUT THE PROVISION "AUTHORIZING THE ARMING OF VESSELS BELONGING TO INDIVDUALS".
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE NOMINATION OF JOHN QUINCY ADAMS TO BE MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY AT THE COURT OF PRUSSIA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION, CONCERNING THE NOMINATION OF JOHN QUINCY ADAMS TO BE MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY AT THE COURT OF PRUSSIA, THAT IN THE OPINION OF THE SENATE THERE IS NO OCCASION THAT A MINISTER SHOULD BE SENT TO PRUSSIA.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES COTESWORTH PINCKNEY, TO BE ONE OF THREE ENVOYS EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY, WITH JOINT AND SEVERAL POWERS, TO FRANCE.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF FRANCIS DANA AS ONE OF THE THREE ENVOYS EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY, WITH JOINT AND SEVERAL POWERS, TO THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN MARSHALL TO BE ONE OF THE THREE ENVOYS EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTERS PLENIPOTENTIARY, WITH JOINT AND SEVERAL POWERS, TO THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF PEACE AND FRIENDSHIP BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE BEY AND SUBJECTS OF TRIPOLI, OF BARBARY.
TO PASS S. 3, A BILL TO RAISE AND ORGANIZE AN ADDITIONAL CORP OF ARTILLERISTS AND ENGINEERS.

TO AMEND S. 4, (APP. 7/1/1797, 1 STAT 523), A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE TRADE OF THE UNITED STATES BY STRIKING FROM THE FIRST SECTION, THE PROVISION TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO PURCHASE AND CAUSE TO BE UTILIZED, A NUMBER OF VESSELS.

TO AMEND THE THIRD SECTION OF S. 4 TO READ "THAT THE PRESIDENT MAY EMPLOY THE SAID FRIGATES, AND THE SAID VESSELS TO PROTECT THE SHIPS AND CARGOS BELONGING SOLELY TO THE CITIZENS OF THE U.S. WITHIN THE HARBORS AND ON THE SEACOAST OF THE U.S., IN SUCH MANER AND UNDER SUCH REGULATIONS, AS SHALL IN NO WAYS CONTRAVENE EITHER THE LAWS OF NATIONS OR ANY EXISTING TREATIES BETWEEN THE U.S

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED THIRD SECTION OF S. 4 WHICH STATES, "THAT THE PRESIDENT MAY EMPLOY CERTAIN FRIGATES AND VESSELS, TO PROTECT THE SHIPS AND CARGOS BELONGING SOLELY TO U.S. CITIZENS, WITHIN THE HARBORS AND ON THE SEACOAST OF THE U.S., IN SUCH MANNER AS SHALL IN NO WAY CONTRAVENE EITHER THE LAWS OF NATIONS OR ANY EXISTING TREATIES BETWEEN THE U.S
TO AMEND S. 4 BY STRIKING OUT THE EIGHTH SECTION, WHICH PROPOSED, "THAT THE PRESIDENT BE AUTHORIZED AND EMPOWERED TO CAUSE TO BE PROCURED AND FITTED OUT, MANNED, AND EMPLOYED, A NUMBER OF VESSELS."
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF THE SENATE BILL TO RAISE AN ADDITIONAL CORPS OF LIGHT DRAGOONS.
TO PASS S. 4

TO AMEND H.R. 1, (APP. 6/23/1797, 1 STAT 521), AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE FURTHER DEFENSE OF THE PORTS AND HARBORS OF THE U.S.; BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE EMPOWERING THE PRESIDENT TO ALLOW STATES INDEBTED TO THE U.S. TO EXPEND THESE DEBTS IN FORTIFICATIONSOF THEIR PORTS AND HARBORS, AND TO CEDE THEIR TITLES TO THE U.S

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ELBRIDGE GERRY TO BE ONE OF THE THREE ENVOYS EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTERS PLENIPOTENTIARY, TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC, IN PLACE OF FRANCIS DANA, WHO HAS DECLINED HIS APPOINTMENT FOR REASONS OF POOR HEALTH.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 19, A BILL TO ENABLE THE PRESIDENT, UNDER CERTAIN RESTRICTIONS, TO RAISE A PROVISIONAL ARMY.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO LAY, REGULATE, AND REVOKE EMBARGOS, BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION WHICH PROPOSED, THAT THE PRESIDENT BE AUTHORIZED TO LAY AN EMBARGO ON ALL SHIPS AND VESSELS IN U.S. PORTS, AND TO CONTINUE OR REVKE THE SAME WHENEVER HE SHALL THINK PROPER: PROVIDED, THE AUTHORITY SHALL NOT BE EXERCISED WHILE THE CONGRESS SHALL BE IN SESSION, AND ANY EMBARGO WHICH MAY BE LAID BY THE PRESIDENT, SHALL CEASE IN FIFTEEN DAYS FROM THE ACTUAL MEETING OF CONGRESS NEXT.
TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL TO DESIGNATE THE TIME FOR THE NEXT MEETING OF CONGRESS, BY CHANGING THE MONTH FROM NOVEMBER TO DECEMBER.
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO LAY, REGULATE, AND REVOKE EMBARGOS.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL TO PREVENT THE ARMING OF PRIVATE SHIPS, EXCEPT IN CERTAIN CASES, BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION WHICH PROPOSED, THAT NO PRIVATE SHIP, BELONGING TO A CERTAIN CITIZEN OF THE U.S., WHICH SHALL BE ARMED, SHALL *****MISSING TEXT**** UNLESS THE SHIP IS REALLY AND TRULY FREIGHTED AND EMPLOYED IN THE MEDITERRANEAN OR AFRICAN TRADE, OR FOR A VOYAGE BEYOND THE CAPE OF GOOD HOPE OR CAPE HORN.
TO PASS H.R. 8, (APP. 7/6/1797, 1 STAT 527), AN ACT LAYING DUTIES ON STAMPED VELLUM, PARCHMENT, AND PAPER.

TO AMEND H.R. 15, (APP. 7/10/1797, 1 STAT 534), AN ACT MAKING ADDITIONAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE YEAR 1797, BY REDUCING THE SUM APPROPRIATED FOR THE EXPENSES OF FOREIGN INTERCOURSE.

TO POSTPONE A REPORT OF A COMMITTEE TO WHOM WAS REFERRED THAT PART OF THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE WHICH RELATES TO A LETTER PURPORTING TO BE WRITTEN BY WILLIAM BLOUNT, A SENATOR FROM TENNESSEE, CONTAINING A RESOLUTION AS PART OF THE REPORT, "THAT WILLIAM BLONT, ESQ., ONE OF THE SENATORS OF THE UNITED STATES, HAVING BEEN GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR, ENTIRELY INCONSISTENT WITH HIS PUBLIC TRUST AND DUTY, AS A SENATOR, BE AND HE HEREBY IS, EXPELLED FROM THE SENATE".

TO ADOPT THE REPORT OF A COMMITTEE TO WHOM WAS REFERRED THAT PART OF THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE RELATING TO A LETTER WRITTEN BY SENATOR BLOUNT, CONTAINING A RESOLUTION THAT "WILLIAM BLOUNT, HAVING BEEN QUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR... HEREBY IS EXPELLED FROMTHE SENATE".
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM SMITH TO BE MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY AT THE COURT OF PORTUGAL.
TO AGREE ON THE COMMITTEE'S REPORT TO RATIFY THE TREATY WITH THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS, MADE SEPT. 15, 1797, AT GENESCO, COUNTY OF ONTARIO AND STATE OF NEW YORK.
TO PASS H.R. 36, (APP. 1/15/1798, 6 STAT 31), AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE PAYMENT OF A CERTAIN SUM TO THE DAUGHTERS OF THE LATE COUNT DE GRASSE.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ARTHUR ST.CLAIR TO BE GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY NORTHWEST OF THE OHIO RIVER.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 25, (APP. 2/1/1798, 1 STAT 539), AN ACT TO SUSPEND, FOR A LIMITED TIME, THE SECOND SECTION OF "AN ACT REGULATING FOREIGN COINS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES".
TO PASS H.R. 25, (APP. 2/1/1798, 1 STAT 539), AN ACT TO SUSPEND, FOR A LIMITED TIME, THE SECOND SECTION OF "AN ACT REGULATING FOREIGN COINS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES".
TO CONSIDER H.R. 56, A BILL TO REPEAL AN ACT LAYING DUTIES ON STAMPED VELLUM, PARCHMENT, AND PAPER.  (P. 490)

TO AMEND H.R. 32, (APP. 1/29/1798, 1 STAT 539), AN ACT TO AMEND THE SEVERAL ACTS FOR LAYING DUTIES ON SPIRITS DISTILLED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, AND STILLS; BY RESTORING THE SECTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR TAKING OUT LICENSES ON STILLS.  (P. 492)

TO ADHERE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 32, (APP. 1/29/1798, 1 STAT 539), AN ACT TO AMEND THE SEVERAL ACTS FOR LAYING DUTIES ON SPIRITS DISTILLED WITHIN THE U.S., AND STILLS; SAID AMENDMENT STRUCK OUT THE SECTION OF THE BILL WHICH PROVIDES FOR TAKING OUT LICESES ON STILLS.
TO POSTPONE THE RESOLUTION RESPECTING AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION PRESCRIBING METHODS FOR PRESIDENTAL ELECTIONS, UNTIL THE FIRST DAY OF JUNE.
TO POSTPONE THE COMMITTEE REPORT CONCERNING THE MODE OF ADMINISTERING OATHS IN CASES OF IMPEACHMENT.
TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT REPORT BY ASKING THAT A RELATED BILL BE BROUGHT IN.
TO AGREE TO THE IMPEACHMENT REPORT.
TO AMEND THE MOTION TO POSTPONE THE SENATE BILL RELATING TO CERTAIN PROCEEDINGS IN CASES OF IMPEACHMENT, BY EXTENDING THE POSTPONEMENT UNTIL JUNE.

TO AGREE TO A PART OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE REPORT CONCERNING S. 43, (APP. 2/27/1798, 1 STAT 539), AN ACT APPROPRIATING A CERTAIN SUM OF MONEY TO DEFRAY THE EXPENSES OF HOLDING A TREATY WITH THE INDIANS; SAID REPORT EXONERATES THE U.S. OF ANY OBLIGATION T ANY STATE OR INDIVIDUAL CITIZEN TO EXTINGUISH ANY INDIAN CLAIMS TO LAND.
TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT BILL BY PROVIDING FOR THE SUMMONING OF A JURY FOR THE TRIAL OF ANY PERSON BROUGHT UP ON CHARGES OF IMPEACHMENT.  (P. 508)
TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT BILL BY PROVIDING FOR THE ASSIGNING OF A TRIAL DATE, ISSUING OF SUMMONS AND SUBPOENAS, AND ALLOCATIONS OF CERTAIN DUTIES.
TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT BILL BY INSERTING THE OATH TO BE TAKEN BY ALL SENATORS PRESENT.
TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE APPOINTED TO PREPARE RULES OF PROCEEDINGS FOR THE IMPEACHMENT OF WILLIAM BLOUNT; TO ISSUE A SUMMONS TO SAID BLOUNT.

TO AMEND S. 12, (APP. 4/7/1798, 1 STAT 549), A BILL FOR AN AMICABLE SETTLEMENT OF LIMITS WITH GEORGIA, AND AUTHORIZING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A GOVERNMENT IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY; SAID AMENDMENT WOULD DELAY PASSAGE OF THE BILL UNTIL CONSENT OF GEORGIASHALL BE OBTAINED.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY WITH THE BEY AND GOVERNMENT OF TUNIS, CONCLUDED AUG., 1797, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 14TH ARTICLE RELATING TO DUTIES.
TO PASS S. 12, (APP. 4/7/1798, 1 STAT 549), A BILL FOR AN AMICABLE SETTLEMENT OF LIMITS WITH GEORGIA, AND AUTHORIZING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A GOVERNMENT IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY.

TO AMEND H.R. 55, (APP. 3/1J/1798, 1 STAT 540), AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR WIDOWS AND ORPHANS OF CERTAIN DECEASED OFFICERS; BY EXCLUDING WIDOWS AND ORPHANS OF THE MILITIA FROM BENEFITS DERIVED FROM THIS ACT.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 55 TO DECEMBER.
TO RECEDE FROM AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 55 WHICH WAS DISAGREED TO BY THE HOUSE; SAID AMENDMENT TO EXCLUDE OFFICERS OF THE MILITIA FROM THE ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 43, (APP. 3/19/1798, 1 STAT 542), AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR 1798, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY STRIKING OUT THE PROVISION FOR COMPENSATION OF THE MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE FOR EXPENSES INCURRED IN THE IMPEAHMENT OF WILLIAM BLOUNT.

TO AMEND H.R. 41, (APP. 3/19/1798, 1 STAT 541), AN ACT PROVIDING THE MEANS OF INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FOREIGN NATIONS; BY STRIKING THE THIRD SECTION WHICH INCREASES THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE BILL.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN QUINCY ADAMS TO BE A COMMISSIONER WITH FULL POWERS TO NEGOTIATE A TREATY OF AMITY AND COMMERCE WITH HIS MAJESTY, THE KING OF SWEDEN. (P. 266)
TO PASS S. 13, (APP. 6/2K/1798, 6 STAT 35), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE A GRANT OF LANDS TO STEPHEN MONOT AND OTHERS, INHABITANTS OF GALLIOPOLIS.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF THE LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES OF THOMAS CLARK.
TO PASS H.R. 58, (APP. 3/2M/1798, 1 STAT 546), AN ACT DECLARING THE CONSENT OF CONGRESS, TO AN ACT OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS.
TO PASS S. 14, (APP. 5/4/1798, 1 STAT L. 555), AN ACT TO ENABLE THE PRESIDENT TO PROCURE ARMS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO LAY AN EMBARGO, FOR A LIMITED TIME, ON CERTAIN SHIPS AND VESSELS.

TO AMEND H.R. 115, (APP. 4/27/1798, 1 STAT 552), A BILL TO PROVIDE AN ADDITIONAL ARMAMENT FOR THE FURTHER PROTECTION OF THE TRADE OF THE UNITED STATES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL ARMED VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE GOVERNED IN HEIR CONDUCT TOWARD FOREIGN ARMED SHIPS, BY THE PROVISIONS OF EXISTING TREATIES OR BY A PRINCIPLE "AS APPLICABLE TO A STATE OF NEUTRALITY".
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 65, (APP. 4/18/1798, 1 STAT 551), AN ACT MAKING AN APPROPRIATION FOR COMPLETING THE BUILDINGS FOR THE ACCOMMODATION OF THE GOVERNMENT, IN WASHINGTON.
TO PASS H.R. 115.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE RESOLUTION "THAT THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE ENVOYS TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC, REFERRED TO IN THE MESSAGE OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE THIRD OF APRIL, BE PRINTED FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE."
TO AUTHORIZE THE PRINTING OF 500 COPIES OF THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE ENVOYS EXTRAORDINARY TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC, FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE.
TO PASS H.R. 65, (APP. 4/18/1798, 1 STAT 551), AN ACT MAKING AN APPROPRIATION FOR COMPLETING THE BUILDINGS FOR THE ACCOMODATION OF THE GOVERNMENT, IN WASHINGTON.
TO AMEND S. 18, (APP. 4/30/1798, 1 STAT 553), A BILL TO ESTABLISH AN EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT NAMED "THE DEPARTMENT OF THE NAVY"; BY EXTENDING THE TERM OF THE BILL FROM ONE YEAR TO FOUR YEARS.
TO PASS S. 18, (APP. 4/30/1798, 1 STAT 553), AN ACT TO ESTABLISH AN EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT TO BE NAMED THE DEPARTMENT OF THE NAVY.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 19, (APP. 5/28/1798, 1 STAT 558), AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO RAISE A PROVISIONAL ARMY.
TO POSTPONE CONDISERATION OF THE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 115.
TO AMEND S. 19, BY PROVIDING THAT NO ENLISTMENT SHALL TAKE PLACE BY VIRTUE OF THIS ACT AFTER THREE YEARS FROM ITS BEING PASSED.
TO PASS S. 19.

TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 115, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE SECTION WHEREIN NO MERCHANT VESSEL FROM A PORT OF THE UNITED STATES TO ANY PLACE THAT IS BESIEGED, SHALL BE TAKEN UNDER THE PROTECTION AND CONVOY OF ANY PUBLIC ARMED VESSEL.
TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 115, TO STRIKE THE SIXTH SECTION WHICH GOVERNS THE CONDUCT OF ALL COMMISSIONED ARMED VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES TOWARD FOREIGN ARMED VESSELS.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT NO MEMBER OF THE SENATE RECEIVE OR GIVE ANY VISIT TO ANY FOREIGN AGENT OR AMBASSADOR OR ANY PERSON WHO AVOWS HIMSELF TO BE A PUBLIC AGENT OR AMBASSADOR FOR A FOREIGN COUNTRY, WITHOUT THE LEAVE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF WINTHROP SARGANT TO BE GOVERNOR OF THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY.  (P. 274)

TO AMEND S. 26, (APP. 6-25-1798, 1 STAT 570), AN ACT CONCERNING ALIENS, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF THE FIRST SECTION WHICH GIVES THE PRESIDENT POWER TO APPOINT PERSONS TO GRANT PERMITS TO SUCH ALIENS AS SHALL BE SUFFERED TO RESIDE IN THE UNITED STATES CNFORMABLY TO PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION TO AUTHORIZE THOMAS PINCKNEY AS A LATE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY TO THE KING OF SPAIN, AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO THE KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, TO RECEIVE THE CUSTOMARY PRESENTS TO FOREIGN MINISTERS AT THESE COURTS.  (P. 553)
TO AMEND S. 19, BY EXEMPTING ANY SOLDIER IN THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES FROM ALL PERSONAL ARRESTS, FOR ANY DEBT OR CONTRACT CREATED SUBSEQUENT TO ENLISTMENT.  (P. 561)

TO AMEND S. 22, (APP. 6/25/1798, 1 STAT 572), AN ACT TO MORE EFFECTIVELY PROTECT THE COMMERCE AND COASTS OF THE UNITED STATES, BY ELIMINATING THE PREAMBLE CONCERNING THE ACTIONS OF FRANCE IN CAPTURING VESSELS AND PROPERTY OF UNITED STATES CITIZENS.
TO POSTPONE S. 22.
TO PASS S. 22.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 23, (APP. 7/16/1798, 1 STAT 609), A BILL TO ALTER AND EXTEND THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT TO ESTABLISH THE JUDICIAL COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES; SAID AMENDMENT TO REPEAL THE FIRST SECTION OF THE ORIGINAL ACT.  (P. 564)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 26, WHICH AMENDMENT MAKES IT COMPULSORY FOR ALL COMMANDERS OF SHIPS OR VESSELS ENTERING ANY PORT IN THE UNITED STATES TO MAKE A REPORT IN WRITING TO THE COLLECTOR OR CUSTOMS OFFICER OF ALL ALIENS ON BOARD HIS VESSEL, AND T TRANSMIT SAID NAMES TO THE OFFICER OF THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE
TO AMEND S. 26, BY GIVING THE PRESIDENT POWER TO REMOVE ANY ALIEN, WHO MAY BE IMPRISONED, UNDER THE ACT, FOR SPEAKING, WRITING, OR PRINTING CONTRARY TO THE PROVISIONS THEREOF. (P. 566)
TO AMEND S. 26, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT GIVES THE PRESIDENT POWER TO REMOVE CERTAIN ALIENS.

TO AMEND S. 26 BY ELIMINATING THE SECTION OF THE ACT WHICH GIVES THE PRESIDENT THE POWER TO REMOVE ANY ALIEN HE MAY CONSIDER DANGEROUS TO THE PEACE OF THE COUNTRY OR WHO IS SUSPECTED IN ANY WAY TREASONABLE OR SECRET MACHINATIONS AGAINST THE GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND S. 26 BY ADDING AN ADDITIONAL CLAUSE TO THE SECTION PROVIDING FOR THE KEEPING OF A RECORD OF ALL ALIENS WHO HAVE BEEN REMOVED TOGETHER WITH THE FACTS ON WHICH THE ORDER OF REMOVAL WAS FOUNDED, SAID RECORD TO BE KEPT WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE DEPRTMENT OF STATE FOR THE INSPECTION OF CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 26 BY OMITTING THE CLAUSE WHICH GIVES AN ALIEN THE PRIVILEGE TO RENOUNCE HIS ALLEGIANCE AND FIDELITY WITHIN A CERTAIN NUMBER OF DAYS AFTER THE PASSAGE OF THIS ACT.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 26, TO EXCLUDE FROM THE EFFECT OF THE BILL, ANY PERSON, BEING AN ALIEN WHO HAS MADE A DECLARATION AND RENOUNCED HIS ALLEGIANCE AND FIDELITY AS IN THE MANNER AND PROVISIONS AS SET FORTH IN "AN ACT TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM RUL OF NATURALIZATION."

TO AMEND S. 26 BY PROVIDING THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT CONTAINED SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO CONTRAVENE ANY PROVISION OF ANY TREATY SUBSISTING BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND ANY FOREIGN NATION. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE).
TO DIVIDE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 26 AND TO AGREE TO THE FIRST DIVISION WHICH PROVIDES THAT ANY ALIEN REMAINING AFTER ORDER OF DEPORTATION, SHALL BE ADJUDGED AND IMPRISONED FOR LIFE.
TO AMEND S. 26 BY RESTORING TO THE ELEVENTH SECTION, THE WORDS, "NOR TO ANY ALIEN MERCHANT".
TO AMEND S. 26 BY RESTORING TO THE ELEVENTH SECTION, THE WORDS "CONFORMING TO SUCH REGULATIONS AS THE PRESIDENT SHALL PRESCRIBE".
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO RATIFY THE ARTICLE EXPLANATORY OF THE FIFTH ARTICLE OF THE TREATY OF AMITY AND COMMERCE AND NAVIGATION WITH ENGLAND.

TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 73, (APP. 6/12/1798, 1 STAT 563), AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT FOR THE YEAR 1798, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, WHICH AMENDMENT CHANGES THE AMOUNT OF THE APPROPRIATION.
TO PASS H.R. 102, (APP. 6/13/1798, 1 STAT 572), AN ACT TO SUSPEND THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FRANCE AND THE DEPENDENCIES THEREOF.
TO AMEND S. 26, BY STATING THAT NOTHING IN THE ACT WILL INTERFERE WITH ANY TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND ANY FOREIGN NATION.
TO AMEND S. 26, BY ORDERING SERVED ON AN ALIEN THE EXPRESS CAUSE OF HIS REMOVAL.
TO PASS S. 26.

TO AMEND H.R. 92, (APP. 6/18/1798, 1 STAT 566), AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO, AND TO AMEND "AN ACT TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM RULE OF NATURALIZATION, AND TO REPEAL THE ACT HERETOFORE PASSED ON THAT SUBJECT;" SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE "FOURTEEN YEARS" FROM THE SECTON STIPULATING THE NUMBER OF YEARS NECESSARY FOR AN ALIEN TO QUALIFY FOR CITIZENSHIP, IN ORDER TO REDUCE THE TIME.

TO AMEND H.R. 92, BY STRIKING OUT THE QUOTED WORDS FROM THE SECTION DECLARING THAT NO ALIEN SHALL BECOME A CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES OR ANY STATE, UNLESS IN THE MANNER PRESCRIBED BY THE EXISTING LAW.
TO PASS H.R. 92.

TO AMEND S. 25, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO ACCEPT ANY ARMED VESSELS OFFERED FOR THE USE OF THE UNITED STATES; BY PROVIDING THAT NO VESSEL OFFERED ON LOAN, SHALL BE ACCEPTED AT A HIGHER RATE OF INTEREST THAN 6% PER ANNUM, UPON THE PRINCIPAL.
TO AMEND S. 25, BY LIMITING THE NUMBER OF GUNS TO BE SUPPLIED BY PRIVATEERS.

TO AGREE TO THE SECOND SECTION OF S. 25, TO PROVIDE THAT IT SHALL BE LAWFUL FOR THE PRESIDENT TO RECEIVE ANY VESSEL, ARMED OR OTHERWISE, FOR THE USE OF THE UNITED STATES WHICH SHALL BE IN ADDITION TO THOSE HERETOFORE PROVIDED.
TO PASS S. 25.
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL (APP. 6/28/1798, 1 STAT 574), IN ADDITION TO AN ACT TO MORE EFFECTUALLY PROTECT THE COMMERCE AND COASTS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO PASS H.R. 106, (APP. 6/22/1798, 1 STAT 569), AN ACT TO AMEND THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT PROVIDING A NAVAL ARMAMENT" AND THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO CAUSE TO BE PURCHASED OR BUILT, A NUMBER OF SMALL VESSELS TO BE EQUIPPED AS GALIES OR OTHERWISE".
TO PASS H.R. 19, (APP. 6/22/1798, 1 STAT 569), AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO "AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO RAISE A PROVISIONAL ARMY."
TO PASS H.R. 109, (APP. 6/25/1798, 1 STAT 572), AN ACT TO AUTHORIZE THE DEFENSE OF THE MERCHANT VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES AGAINST FRENCH DEPREDATIONS.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 28, (APP. 6/27/1798, 1 STAT 573), AN ACT TO PUNISH FRAUDS COMMITTED ON THE BANK OF THE U.S.; WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES PUNISHMENT BY IMPRISONMENT AND FINE TO BE DETERMINED BY THE SENATE.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 28.
TO PASS S. 28.

TO AGREE TO THE ENACTING CLAUSE OF S. 29, (APP. 7/7/1798, 1 STAT 578), AN ACT TO DECLARE ALL TREATIES WITH FRANCE, NO LONGER OBLIGATORY ON THE UNITED STATES; SAID CLAUSE PROVIDES THAT THE TREATY OF AMITY AND COMMERCE AND THE TREATY OF ALLIANCE BETWEEN TH UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE CONCLUDED ON 2/6/1778 ARE HEREBY DECLARED VOID AND OF NO EFFECT AND SHALL NO LONGER BIND THE U.S
TO POSTPONE S. 29, UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 29.
TO PASS S. 29.

TO REFER THE MOTION TO BRING IN S. 31, (APP. 7/14/1798, 1 STAT 596), AN ACT IN ADDITION TO THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CERTAIN CRIMES AGAINST THE UNITED STATES", TO A COMMITTEE FOR CONSIDERATION.
TO BRING IN THE BILL, S. 31, FOR CONSIDERATION.
TO ORDER SECOND READING OF S. 31.
TO COMMIT S. 31 TO A SELECT COMMITTEE.
TO PASS H.R. 115.

TO AMEND S. 30, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO REGULATE THE LANDING OF FRENCH PASSENGERS AND OTHER FOREIGNERS WHO MAY ARRIVE WITHIN THE UNITED STATES; SAID AMENDMENT TO READ: "NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO PROHIBIT THE MIGRATION OR IMPOTATION OF SUCH PERSONS AS ANY STATE MAY THINK PROPER BY LAW TO ADMIT, NOR TO SUCH PERSONS WHOSE ADMISSION MAY BE PROHIBITED BY THE RESPECTIVE STATES".
TO AMEND S. 30 BY PROHIBITING A NUMBER OF FRENCH WHITE MEN AND NEGROES FROM PORT AU PRINCE, WHICH IS BEING EVACUATED BY THE BRITISH, FROM ADMISSION TO THE UNITED STATES. (REJECTED BY A TIE VOTE).
TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO S. 30, BY PERMITTING ADMISSION TO THE U.S. ONLY TO CHILDREN AND WOMEN WHOM THE PRESIDENT MAY AUTHORIZE, FROM AMONG THE FRENCH EVACUATED BY THE BRITISH FROM PORT AU PRINCE.

TO AMEND H.R. 143, (APP. 7/9/1798, 1 STAT 580), A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE VALUATION OF LANDS AND HOUSES, AND THE ENUMERATION OF SLAVES, WITHIN THE UNITED STATES; BY EXEMPTING ALL UNCULTIVATED LANDS, WITH CERTAIN SPECIFIED EXCEPTIONS, FROM ASSESSMENT.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO STRIKE OUT, AND TO RESTORE THE PROVISION OF H.R. 143, WHICH EXEMPTED FROM ASSESSMENT, LANDS WHICH HAVE NOT BEEN ASSESSED OR TAXED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE STATE WHERE SUCH LAND IS SITUATED.
TO AMEND H.R. 143, BY EXEMPTING FROM ENUMERATION AND ASSESSMENT, SUCH SLAVES AS MAY BE INCAPABLE OF LABOR.
TO AMEND H.R. 143 BY STRIKING THE PROVISO THAT LIMITS THE ENUMERATION OF SLAVES TO THOSE FROM 12 TO 50 YEARS OF AGE.
TO AMEND H.R. 143 IN ORDER TO ASSESS LOTS AND HOUSES FOR THE VALUE THEY WOULD HAVE IF THEY MIGHT BE SOLD FOR IMMEDIATE PAYMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 143, BY EXCLUDING FROM DIRECT TAXATION, ALL UNCULTIVATED LANDS, EXCEPT SUCH AS MAKE PART OR PARCEL OF A FARM, AND EXCEPT WOOD LOTS USED OR RESERVED FOR THE PURPOSE OF FUEL, FENCING, LUMBER OR BUILDING.
TO AMEND H.R. 143, BY ELIMINATING THE AGE LIMIT ON SLAVES TO BE ENUMERATED.
TO PASS H.R. 143.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF GEORGE WASHINGTON TO BE LIEUTENANT GENERAL AND COMMANDER IN CHIEF OF THE ARMY.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 31.
TO PASS H.R. 61, (APP. 7/9/1798, 1 STAT 580), AN ACT LIMITING THE TIME WITHIN WHICH CLAIMS AGAINST THE UNITED STATES FOR CREDITS ON THE BOOKS OF THE TREASURY MAY BE PRESENTED FOR ALLOWANCE.
TO AMEND S. 31, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF ANY PERSON WHO SHALL PRINT, PUBLISH, SPEAK, TRADUCE OR DEFAME THE PRESIDENT, OR ANY COURT OR JUDGE THEREOF.
TO AMEND S. 31, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION TO MAKE IT A CRIME TO ISSUE ANY SCANDALOUS OR LIBELOUS WRITING AGAINST THE PRESIDENT OR ANY COURT OR JUDGE.
TO PASS S. 31.
TO PASS H.R. 217, AN ACT TO AMEND AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE SALE OF UNITED STATES LANDS IN THE TERRITORY NORTHWEST OF THE RIVER OHIO, AND ABOVE THE MOUTH OF THE KENTUCKY RIVER.
TO PASS H.R. 119, (APP. 7/9/1798, 1 STAT 578), AN ACT TO FURTHER PROTECT UNITED STATES COMMERCE.
TO AMEND H.R. 116, (APP. 7/14/1798, 1 STAT 597), AN ACT TO AMEND AN ACT TO LAY AND COLLECT A DIRECT TAX WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, BY STRIKING OUT THE LIMITATION UPON LOTS AND DWELLING HOUSES.
TO AMEND H.R. 116, BY EXEMPTING LANDS THAT HAVE NOT BEEN ASSESSED OR TAXED BY THE STATES WITHIN WHICH THEY ARE SITUATED.
TO AMEND H.R. 116 IN ORDER TO MAKE TAXABLE ALL PERSONAL PROPERTY.
TO AMEND H.R. 113, (APP. 7/16/1798, 1 STAT 607), AN ACT TO ENABLE THE PRESIDENT TO BORROW MONEY FOR THE PUBLIC SERVICE, BY STIPULATING A DEFINITE SUM OF MONEY AS THE AMOUNT TO BE BORROWED.
TO AMEND H.R. 113, BY LIMITING THE RATE OF INTEREST TO BE PAID TO 6%.
TO AMEND H.R. 113, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE LOANS ARE TO BE FIXED AND IRREDEEMABLE FOR 25 YRS.
TO AMEND H.R. 113, BY RESTORING THE ORIGINAL PROVISION TO ALLOW THE PRESIDENT TO BORROW ANY AMOUNT HE MAY DEEM NECESSARY.
TO PASS H.R. 139, AN ACT FOR ENCOURAGING THE CAPTURE OF FRENCH ARMED VESSELS, BY ARMED SHIPS OWNED BY UNITED STATES CITIZENS, AND TO ALLOW A SALVAGE IN CERTAIN CASES.
TO INSIST ON THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 116 WHICH WOULD ELIMINATE THE VALUATION TO BE PLACED ON LAND AND DWELLINGS FROM $100 TO $500.
TO RECEDE FROM THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 116 WHICH PLACES A FIVE HUNDRED DOLLAR MAXIMUM VALUATION OF LOTS AND DWELLING HOUSES.
TO AMEND THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 31 BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS "OR BRING THEM INTO CONTEMPT OR DISREPUTE, OR TO EXCITE AGAINST THEM THE HATRED OF THE GOOD PEOPLE OF THE UNITED STATES."
TO AMEND THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 31, BY STRIKING OUT: "DURING THE TIME IT SHALL BE IN FORCE" AND TO INSERT: "WHICH PROSECUTION SHALL HAVE BEEN COMMENCED DURING THE CONTINUANCE OF THE ACT."
TO PASS H.R. 123, (APP. 7/16/1798, 1 STAT 608), AN ACT MAKING FURTHER APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE ADDITIONAL NAVAL ARMAMENT.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 110, AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE ENUMERATION OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE U.S., TO THE NEXT SESSION.
TO PASS H.R. 125, (APP. 7/16/1798, 1 STAT 604), AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE ARMY, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 103, (APP. 2/11/1800, 6 STAT L. 39), AN ACT TO PROVIDE AN ALLOWANCE FOR LOSSES SUSTAINED BY JOHN VAUGHN, ON A DEPOSIT OF BULLION IN THE MINT, IN CONSEQUENCE OF INTERVENING REGULATIONS.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT THE 13TH RULE, WHICH PROHIBITS THE SECOND READING OF A BILL ON THE SAME DAY, BE SUSPENDED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SESSION.

TO POSTPONE H.R. 128, (APP. 2/15/1799, 1 STAT L. 616), AN ACT RESPECTING BALANCES REPORTED AGAINST CERTAIN STATES, BY THE COMMISSIONERS APPOINTED TO SETTLE THE ACCOUNTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE SEVERAL STATES.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO ORDER THIRD READING OF THE BILL TO CHANGE THE DATE OF THE NEXT MEETING OF CONGRESS.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT THE TWELFTH RULE FOR DOING BUSINESS IN THE SENATE WHICH PROHIBITS THE READING OF A BILL ON THE SAME DAY IN WHICH IT IS ANNOUNCED, BE SUSPENDED FOR THE RESIDUE OF THE SESSION.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 103 TO THE NEXT SESSION.
TO PASS H.R. 103. (REJECTED ON A TIE VOTE).
TO POSTPONE H.R. 128, TO THE NEXT SESSION.
TO AMEND H.R. 128, BY STRIKING OUT THE NINTH AND TENTH LINES IN THE FIRST SECTION.
TO PASS H.R. 128.

TO AGREE TO THE RULING OF THE COURT THAT THE COURT HAVING ON THE 18TH OF THIS MONTH, ADMITTED JARED INGERSOLL AND A.J. DALLAS, TO APPEAR AND PLEAD FOR WILLIAM BLOUNT, ON THE IMPEACHMENT NOW DEPENDING AGAINST HIM, AND THE COURT HAVING BEEN SATISFIED THAT HE SAID COUNSEL WERE DULY AUTHORIZED, ARE OF THE OPINION THAT IT IS NOT NECESSARY THAT ANY WARRANT OF ATTORNEY OR OTHER WRITTEN AUTHORITY BE FILED IN THIS COURT.
TO ALLOW COUNSEL FOR THE DEFENDENT, WILLIAM BLOUNT, ADDITIONAL TIME, IN THE IMPEACHMENT PROCEEDINGS AGAINST BLOUNT.

TO GRANT LEAVE TO BRING IN A BILL AUTHORIZING THE ACCEPTANCE FROM THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT, OF A CESSION OF THE JURISDICTION OF THE TERRITORY WEST OF PENNSYLVANIA, COMMONLY CALLED THE WESTERN RESERVE OF CONNICTICUT.
TO ADJOURN AND ALLOW THE MANAGERS OF THE SENATE, A WEEK, IN ORDER TO GIVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO FILE REPLY, IN THE IMPEACHMENT PROCEEDINGS AGAINST WILLIAM BLOUNT.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION "THAT WILLIAM BLOUNT WAS A CIVIL OFFICER OF THE UNITED STATES AND THEREFORE LIABLE TO IMPEACHMENT.. THAT AS ARTICLES OF IMPEACHMENT CHARGE HIM WITH HIGH CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS, SUPPOSED COMMITTED WHILE HE WAS A UNITED STATES SNATOR, HIS PLEA OUGHT TO BE OVERRULED."

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION WHICH RESOLVES "THAT WILLIAM BLOUNT WAS A CIVIL OFFICER OF THE UNITED STATES AND THEREFORE LIABLE TO IMPEACHMENT... THAT AS ARTICLES OF IMPEACHMENT CHARGE HIM WITH HIGH CRIMES AND MISDEMENORS, SUPPOSED COMMITTED WHILE HE WAS A UNITED STATES SENATOR, HIS PLEA OUGHT TO BE OVERRULED", SAID RESOLUTION BEING THAT THE COURT OUGHT NOT TO HOLD JURISDICTION OF THE SAID IMPEACHMENT; AND THAT THE SAID IMPEACHMENT BE DISMISSED.
TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE ENUMERATION OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE UNITED STATES, BY PROVIDING THAT THE ENUMERATION SHALL COMMENCE ON THE FIRST MONDAY IN APRIL, 1800.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY WITH THE CHEROKEE INDIANS OF OCT. 2, 1798.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 1/30/1799, 1 STAT 613), AN ACT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CERTAIN CRIMES THEREIN SPECIFIED.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL (APP. 3/3/1799, 1 STAT 749), FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE TROOPS OF THE UNITED STATES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; SAID AMENDMENT TO CHANGE THE TITLE OF CERTAIN OFFICERS APPOINTED THEREAFTER.

TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 2/15/1799, 1 STAT 616), AN ACT RESPECTING THE BALANCE REPORTED AGAINST CERTAIN STATES, BY THE COMMISSION APPOINTED TO SETTLE THE ACCOUNTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE STATES.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 2/9/1799, 1 STAT 613), FOR FURTHER SUSPENSION OF COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FRANCE, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION TO RESTRICT THE RIGHT OF THE PRESIDENT TO DISCONTINUE RESTRAINTS WITH REGARD TO FRANC.
TO AMEND THE FRENCH TRADE BILL BY PROHIBITING THE PRESIDENT TO SUSPEND ALL COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE WEST INDIES.

TO AMEND THE FRENCH TRADE BILL BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO: THAT A NOTICE OF NOT LESS THAN NINETEEN DAYS OF THE OPENING COMMERCE WITH THE FRENCH REPUBLIC, OR ANY PORT OR PLACE UNDER THE GOV'T THEREOF, BY AUTHORITY OF THIS ACT, AND NOT LESS THAN THIRT DAYS OF THE REVOCATION OF ANY ORDER ISSUED BY THE PRESIDENT, BY VIRTUE OF THIS ACT, SHALL BE GIVEN".
TO AMEND THE FRENCH TRADE BILL BY PROVIDING THAT NO LESS THAN 30 DAYS NOTICE BE GIVEN OF REVOCATION OF ANY ORDER UNDER THIS ACT.
TO PASS THE FRENCH TRADE BILL.

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL TO AMEND THE ACT, ENTITLED "AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE SALE OF LANDS IN THE U.S. IN THE TERRITORY NORTHWEST OF THE RIVER OHIO, AND ABOVE THE MOUTH OF THE KENTUCKY RIVER", BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION THAT GRANTS ALIENS THE SAME RIGHS AS CITIZENS IN HOLDING LANDS.

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM SMITH TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY, TO THE SUBLIME OTTOMAN PORTE WITH FULL POWERS TO NEGOTIATE A TREATY OF AMITY AND COMMERCE WITH SAME.
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL (APP. 3/3/1799, 1 STAT 743), A BILL TO VEST THE POWER OF RETALIATION, IN CERTAIN CASES, IN THE PRESIDENT.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY WITH THE ONEIDA INDIANS ON BEHALF OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, MADE ON JUNE 1, 1798.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE BILL , (APP. 3/2/1799, 1 STAT 725), A BILL GIVING EVENTUAL AUTHORITY TO THE PRESIDENT TO AUGMENT THE ARMY; BY PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT'S AUTHORITY TO CALL FORTH VOLUNTEERS IS DERIVED FROM THE ACT, ENTITLED, "ANACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE CALLING FORTH OF THE MILITIA TO EXECUTE THE LAWS OF THE UNION, ETC."
TO PASS THE ARMY BILL.
TO HAVE THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE AND THE NOMINATION CONTAINED THEREIN OF WILLIAM VANS MURRAY TO THE OFFICE OF MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO FRANCE, REFERRED TO A COMMITTEE OF 5 MEMBERS.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF EDWARD STEVENS TO BE CONSUL GENERAL IN ST. DOMINGO.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE BILL AUTHORIZING THE ACCEPTANCE, FROM THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT, OF A CESSION OF JURISDICTION OF THE TERRITORY WEST OF PENNSYLVANIA, COMMONLY CALLED THE WESTERN RESERVE OF CONNECTICUT; WHICH AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE RESIDENT TO RELEASE TO THE GOVERNOR OF CONNECTICUT, THOSE LANDS SOLD AND KNOWN AS THE CONNECTICUT LAND COMPANY
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF THE SENATE BILL, (APP. 3/2/1799, 1 STAT 729), FOR THE AUGMENTATION OF SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL AUTHORIZING THE ACCEPTANCE, FROM CONNECTICUT, OF A CESSION OF JURISDICTION OF THE WESTERN RESERVE OF CONNECTICUT.
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL, (APP. 3/2/1799, 1 STAT 729), TO AUGMENT SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE EXECUTIVE DEPT.

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF OLIVER ELLSWORTH TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC FOR THE DISCUSSION AND SETTLEMENT, BY TREATY, OF ALL CONTROVERSIES, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FRANCE.

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF PATRICK HENRY TO BE AN ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO FRENCHANCH REPUBLIC FOR THE DISCUSSION AND SETTLEMENT, BY TREATY, OF ALL CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FRANCE.

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM VANS MURRAY TO BE AN ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY, TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC FOR THE DISCUSSION AND SETTLEMENT, BY A TREATY, OF ALL CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FRANCE.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 3/2/1799, 1 STAT 733), TO ESTABLISH THE POST OFFICE, BY ADDING "ALL THE LETTERS AND PACKETS FRANKED BY ANY ONE MEMBER OF CONGRESS, IN ANY ONE WEEK, SHALL NOT EXCEED THIRTY OUNCES."
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF THE HOUSE BILL TO AUTHORIZE A DETACHMENT FROM THE UNITED STATES MILITIA.
TO AMEND THE MILITIA BILL BY PROVIDING THAT IT SHALL BE LAWFUL FOR THE PRESIDENT TO FORBEAR TO CALL ON THE EXECUTIVE AUTHORITY OF ANY PARTICULAR STATE OR STATES EAST OF THE RIVER POTOMAC.
TO POSTPONE THE MILITIA BILL TO THE NEXT SESSION.

TO AGREE TO THE MOTION THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE PAY OUT OF THE CONTINGENT MONEY, TO THE PRINCIPAL AND ENGROSSING CLERK IN HIS OFFICE, ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS EACH, FOR EXTRA SERVICES DURING THE PRESENT SESSION.
